body: The only reason why we need this `S` is to prevent slicing. Can't we just keep datasets on the heap? There's no reason why they have to live on the stack, since they're not short lived objects that you instantiate a lot
body_html: The only reason why we need this S is to prevent slicing. Can't we just keep datasets on the heap? There's no reason why they have to live on the stack, since they're not short lived objects that you instantiate a lot
body_text: The only reason why we need this S is to prevent slicing. Can't we just keep datasets on the heap? There's no reason why they have to live on the stack, since they're not short lived objects that you instantiate a lot
